newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordanian bank assets slip fractionally in January.
newsitem.headline: Jordanian bank assets slip fractionally in January.

text.p: Total assets of Jordanian banks slipped fractionally in January to 8.854 billion dinars ($12.51 billion) from 8.858 billion dinars in December, the Central Bank statistical bulletin said.
Total deposits with licenced banks rose 0.43 percent to 6.015 billion dinars but foreign currency deposits fell 0.98 percent to 2.334 billion dinars.
Year-on-year total assets were 6.0 percent higher from January 1996 when they stood at 8.349 billion dinars, while total deposits grew by under four percent.
NOTE -- The figures cover Jordan's 20 licensed banks including six investment banks and five subsidiaries of foreign banks operating under similar Central Bank rules.
